data.title: Quick lunch was delicious!
data.text: Popped in on a Friday for lunch. Settled on the veggie plate.  It was wonderful!  Buttered potatoes, collards, baked apples, and the Tex-Mex salad (black beans/corn). Came with a fluffy pan biscuit. Highly recommend. I liked seeing how busy Grow was; good sign folks are taking note and coming back for more. Service is courteous and warm and the food is comforting and delicious!

data.title: Fresh, local eats!
data.text:
I discovered Grow, a local restaurant that specializes in farm-to-table goodness, when I was looking for a new place for our office to try for lunch.  Our office often gets lunch brought in and we try to change up our usual selections.  We all love Grow for their fresh offerings that concentrate on local, organic veggies, fruits, meats and eggs.  Since the restaurant is farm-to-table, their menu changes very often.  You can always find a most recent menu listing on their Facebook page.  Some of the standards they always have include pimento cheese, chicken salad, and eggplant parmesan.  The eggplant parmesan is delicious and served in half an eggplant; it is so light and not heavy tasting at all. And the eggplant never tastes bitter.  My most recent choice was their grilled peach salad with grilled chicken!  OMG! It was one of the best salads I have ever eaten! It was loaded with fresh, local mixed Spring greens, a nut and seed mix, raisins, red onion, feta cheese, grilled chicken chunks and juicy, sweet grilled peach halves-all locally sourced!  I got the salad with a Vidalia onion vinaigrette that was perfect with the sweetness of the peaches, tanginess of the feta cheese and the sharpness of the red onion.  The only drawback to the salad, in my opinion, was a hunk of cold bread on the side.  It wasn't good and the salad didn't need it.  
Other meals we have had there include a chicken teriyaki wok with smashed sweet potatoes that one of co-workers said was yummy.  And another one of my co-workers absolutely loves their rutabaga fries.  They've also offered a strawberry salad that you can get with grilled chicken and it is very good.  If they have egg salad on the menu made with fresh farm eggs, definitely try that!  You can really taste the difference between egg salad made with local eggs versus store-bought ones.  
We look forward to getting lunches from Grow, love the changing menu to reflect the seasons and always feel healthier knowing we are eating food fresh from the farm.  And we love supporting our hometown Macon businesses!

data.title: The food is so good
data.text: The food is so good. Try the ECERYTHING. YOU can order anything and it is wonderful. I love it. Fresh food good folks. Just need to get their catering business on track. But if your free for lunch.....GO YOU WILL NOT BE SORRY

data.title: Baked Zuchinni & Squash casserole
data.text: The baked zuchinni was covered with sausage, marinara sauce, cheese and grilled.  The squash casserole had a little cheese and butter and crumbs but was not greasy or over-done with cheese.  Both were seasoned to perfection and served quickly and professionally.  There were many things on the menu I wish I could have tried.  My lunchmate had the chicken salad and a peach-and-cheese flatbread which she said was amazing.  We got there at noon and it was packed.

data.title: Unorganized (Catering)
data.text:
I was going to book Grow for my wedding. My fiancé and I booked an appointment with her and both times the owner was late and unprepared. She never sent over the contract and "lost" two money orders that were cashed but not put on file. The food we tasted was exceptional but the professionalism or lack there of is what drove us away. We were also told by the other venues that Grow was very unorganized and often looked scattered. 

I am disappointed because I have less than 4 months to find another caterer.

data.title: Fresh food
data.text:
Stopped here on way south and ordered the Monte Cristo, which is one of my favorite sandwiches and rarely find at restaurants.  The sandwich was good but not the best I've had.  The chips and pico were excellent and the sweet potato mash lacked something, it was a bit bland.  I ended with the blackberry cobbler with whipped cream and it was very good.

The menu was short but had items for just about any taste.  

The service was friendly and good.  I might give it another try if in the area.

data.title: Best Soup Ever
data.text: I was impressed with the food and service.  Both are 5 out of 5. The leaking roof into a water picture was horrible.

data.title: Great stuff
data.text: Scratch cooking, locally sourced, nice people and boiled peanuts on every table...what's not to like!

data.title: What a gem!
data.text: I had the sampler platter because I couldn't decide what to get. The pimento cheese, pickles, and bread were awesome! I need to go for dinner one night. This is the kind of unique place you should show off to visitors from out of town.

data.title: An Oasis of Good, Fresh Food
data.text:
The wife and I are out from California on our Anniversary trip, exploring the Georgia magic and traveling down to Savannah (of course). Loving all the BBQ and great Southern cooking, but, man, starting to feel a bit fat and slow after a few days of it. So, got on Yelp and Trip Advisor  last night and found this little oasis of fresh food in the sea of chain places and deep-fat fryers. Hoped it would be good.

Pleased to say we were not disappointed! Easy freeway access, clean, super, super friendly staff, and our order came almost instantly. Really fresh, really good stuff. And remember, we're snotty, judgmental California people who take access to great produce for granted and expect it to be fresh. This place would easily hold its own against all the insufferable, entitled "local-vore" places back home! 

Moist and fluffy cornbread. Even the fried eggplant my wife had (well, SOMETHING has to be fried...we do love it) was done with a light hand. Got out of there for only $21 for two and didn't feel like "blimp-boy" afterward. (So now I can pig out and booze it up in Savannah!)

These folks care and seem to really be trying to make a go of it. In a world where indifference is the norm, this very refreshing and I hope they succeed in this endeavor. (Our waitress told us they have a Facebook page with the latest specials and weekly menus, so you might take a look for that.) I guess they are also starting to give a try at dinner a few nights a week too.

data.title: Farm to table
data.text: Food is amazing and fresh from the fields! Saralyn is always changing up the menu to serve creative dishes! Looking forward to dinner being served Tuesday through Friday until 830 PM!!

data.title: Great
data.text: Wonderful fresh food, good prompt service, fresh bright ambience, reasonable prices, good selection of a sorts of menu items. Everything sounded good !

data.title: Great food, Fast, Friendly, Fresh
data.text:
Small restaurant with simple decor and overall atmosphere. Seated ourselves and an extremely friendly server was right with us to take our order and offer fresh boiled peanuts. The menu is short and sweet. Sandwiches, salads, soups, some specialty entrees. No fried foods and EVERYTHING is organic, super fresh, & hormone free. Ultimate grilled chicken sandwich with side salad and homemade ranch dressing was great. Chicken was slightly overcooked, otherwise I would have given this restaurant five stars. My husband ordered Pimento cheese sandwich and added bacon. He also got a soup, and commented that both were great. I heard that the squash casserole was one of their most popular side dishes, but we did not try it. Favorite parts of the whole experience were the serene ambience, the friendly server, the ranch dressing, sweet tea and affordable price. Our check
 totaled somewhere between $21 and $25 before tip,I will definitely be coming back to try out more.

data.title: Delicious lunch food!!!
data.text: Group of five loved everything we ordered from teriyaki wok chicken, spinach salad (huge portion with warm bacon and mustard dressing), cream of broccoli and potato soup, corn bread, black eye peas, chicken salad, egg salad, hoppin' john salad.  Only disappointment was the pimento cheese - no flavor or taste?!?!

data.title: Local, Fresh, Farm to Table
data.text:
I am a local and have visited many, many restaurants in the area.  This is the only one that can boast as being "local, fresh, and farm to table".  The food is bought locally and prepared on site by the owner and her small staff.  They are good!

The menu consists of vegan, organic, and traditional dishes.  Try the Goat Cheese Lollipops as a starter.  An excellent concept that I've had nowhere else/ goat cheese is rolled in a variety of coatings (nuts, honey, bacon, cranberries, fresh herbs) and served as a six-count appetizer.  Certainly give this a try.  

For lunch I had Eggplant Parmesan.   This is not your normal eggplant which is traditionally heavily breaded and fried.  This dish consists of sliced fresh eggplant covered in marinara and cheese and then baked.  Don't expect deep fried with this.  Do expect a refreshing new twist on an old classic.  

The service at Grow was very attentive but not intrusive.  The owner and chef came by at different times just to check to see that everything was going well.  I did speak with the owner and inquired about any gluten free offerings and she assured me that there are several dishes on the menu that are gluten free and she can alter others to meet the dietary need.  Overall, everyone was pleasant, enthusiastic and accommodating.  

Given that the location of Grow is less than a mile off the interstate, I'd recommend that anyone travelling through Macon make the quick stop off the interstate to stop in.  This restaurant is truly a find and should not be missed.

One note worth mentioning - as the food is obtained locally, I am told that the menu can change from week to week depending on what's available.   The day I was in, there was a variety of offerings ranging from grilled chicken, salads, soup, sandwiches, chicken stir-fry, their signature sloppy joe and a classic hamburger steak.  I believe that you should be able to check their Facebook page for the current menu.  Regardless of what's on the menu today, based on my meal, I can only imagine that it will be fantastic!

Finally, although, I turned it down, there was salted caramel cake for dessert.  It sounded delicious and I'm kinda wishing I hadn't passed on it, but I'm sure that I'll go back and see if I can catch this when it's available again.  

I'll recommend that you grow by today and enjoy an extraordinary local, fresh, farm-to-table experience.

data.title: Absolutely the best!
data.text: If I could advance this restaurant into the top ten in Macon, I would!  It is relatively new.  The food is brought in from local farms around central Georgia - a real farm to table concept.  The vegetables are divine!  A vegetarian's dream come true!  My husband had grilled chicken and it looked wonderful.  The service is thoughtful and personal.  I think at least three people came to check on us while we ate, including the owner and the cook.  It is just a special place and I hope it flourishes because there is truly nothing like it in Macon.  Do not pass by!  It is a quick stop off the interstate if you are passing through Macon.  I don't often assign five stars to a restaurant.  This one deserves it.
